alert.note: Alert for Bullitt (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 2:35PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, Bullitt, Hardin, Nelson and Spencer. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 235 PM EST, emergency management reported continued flooding and road closures in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elizabethtown, Shepherdsville, Radcliff, Mount Washington, Hillview, Vine Grove, Lebanon Junction, West Point, Fairfield and Belmont. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely and have them relay your report to the National Weather Service in Louisville.
